datafield.subfield: Unrestricted in reading room, but coach user: tight binding, open only to 90Â°; available for classroom use in exhibit case only.
Johannes Kepler, 1571-1630 Quadricentennial Celebration: An Exhibit of Books, Manuscripts, and Related Material (exhibit catalog, 1972).
Johannes Kepler, 1571-1630: Quadricentennial Celebration: An Exhibit of Books, Manuscripts, and Related Material (Humanities Research Center: Austin 1972), #30, p. 14.
At least three different hands present. Charts and diagrams are included, some in margins. Tables include lists of solar and lunar eclipses.

Collection of treatises on astronomy and mathematics, including tabulae astronomicae for finding solar and lunar eclipses, mnemonic devices for computistical purposes including a cisiojanus text and the Tractatus quadrantes secundum modernos, Ad habendum ortum solarem secundum garlandiam, Johannes of Sacrobosco's De sphaera mundi, and Algorismus.

MS 3327, Container 62: Walter Emile van Wijk (1887-1961), square bookplate. DIDB record 53698. Binding: Full calf(?) skin parchment (re-used material) over heavy paper spine stiffener. Straight caps, cut edges, natural hollow. Title written in ink on spine. Sewing not visible. Textile spine lining. Endleaf components: front [tipped] fold ecru modern [machine-made?] paper, making pastedown, free endleaf; back same.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection
